name: Prince Desert Camp

reviews.text: We recently spent a night in this camp. What a magical experience. I wouldn't exactly call it luxurious but as I don't go Camping maybe it was
reviews.title: Magical experience.

reviews.text: It seemed to be the only camp on its own which made it nice and quiet.
reviews.title: " The only dessert camp in jaisalmer"

reviews.text: The camel ride to the dunes and then watching the sunset was an experience I'll never forget. The people leading the camels were just gorgeous.
reviews.title: “A very relaxing night away from the hustle and crowd

reviews.text: The tents were comfortable enough and each tent had its own bathroom but the day we were there there was no water.
reviews.title: Worth the experience

reviews.text: Probably this is the only dessert camp in a true sense since it is virtually located at the base of the sand dunes. Most of the big named camps on the road side on the way to prince give you a feel of road side relief camps.
reviews.title: “A Wonderful time! Highly Recommended!”

reviews.text: It was the best trip of my life ever. It is just awesome, nothing else. I suggested to all my friend's come here and experience the FUN. And the most important thing if you want to join me than come on 31st and celebrate the NEW YEAR with me.
reviews.title: the unforgottable

reviews.text: The best thing:- The staff is very good.
reviews.title: Nice, calm tents, away from the crowded area

reviews.text: We had booked tents for New years eve but could not go due to family issues... Mr. Gajendra was very thoughtful and accommodating and allowed us to postpone the dates on same package/rates.
reviews.title: Sitting pretty amidst the sand dunes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tents are as they are shown on the website unlike many other tents in that area who fool people by fake pictures.
reviews.title: The BEST!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was good, evening Rajasthani folk program was good and invites guests to try local dance with the dancers. It was fun! Please note no DJ here unlike the main road tents...
reviews.title: desert experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had an awesome and amazing experience at this camp. Prince camp is well located near the sand dune and is away from rest of the camps which adds a positive experience for a couple.
reviews.title: "peaceful camping in desert"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Camp staff and manager was really helpful. Our camp was well cleaned and decorated. I strongly suggest to visit this area in the season( Nov-Jan) as we were alone in this camp on 4th Oct. During our stay at night the camp power supply went off and there was no power backup which added up lil uncomfy as were alone. The camp manager hospitality was awesome.
reviews.title: “so amazing camp in desert.”

reviews.text: Prince desert camp was very nice. i would like this so much. & I want to again & Again. well worth the money as the experience is unique and lots of extras such as , the unique tradionational dance n camel rides n option to walk on dunes in 2 minutes and so calm than other camps n option to stay also on sand dunes under stars
reviews.title: A memorable desert experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful, fun stay at Prince. It is near the dunes but still far enough away from the other camps in the area to believe you are the only ones around. It was towards the end of the tourist season when I was there so the camp was very peaceful and quiet.
reviews.title: away from crowed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staying in their tents was an extremely luxurious experience. The tents are clean and spacious with two double beds, a large bathroom with a toilet and running water. Not your typical thought when it comes to camping. However, if you want a truly unique experience, they will arrange for you to stay in the desert sleeping on the sand under the stars.
reviews.title: best in jaisalmer

reviews.text: 1.Moderately nice facilities according for a "Camp".
reviews.title: If you want to have a different experience, then only recommended!

reviews.text: 2.Separate areas are marked as outer area, bedroom and bathroom-all clean.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.text: 3.Cultural programme(Rajasthani Kalbelia dance, stunts, folk songs) around bonfire is entertaining and decent.
reviews.title: Memorable Desert Experience!!

reviews.text: 4.Open nice seating and snacks are served in between in generous amounts.
reviews.title: Princely treatment..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 5.Dinner buffet was average but maybe because it was in the middle of the desert.
reviews.title: Unforgettable experience

description: The prince desert Camp is an exclusive camp experince at the golden sanddunes of sam lakhmana dunes.Every time you step onto the endless expanse of sun-kissed, gilded sands of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan, your sense are ensconced in the calming tranquility and stillness of the place. The camp promises a truly unparalleled experience of the desert in itselement. It is a toast to the erstwhile Maharajas and you are treated to one with a panache that leves you overwhelmed. Just as the royalty camped it Tents(khemas) away from the palaces, the resort spins a similar ambience with its modern Swiss cottage tents right in the midst of the desert. Just as the royalty traversed stretches of desert on camels, the evenings see you astride colorfully caparisoned camels led by ethnically dressed butlers as you begin your sojourn of miles of shimmering sand dunes ito the sunset. Lounging on the dunes, one can only gaze in breathless wonderment as the sun begins to go down and casts an ember halo over the desert h orizon
